title: MADE Australia Gallery #2: Gravel and Cargo Bike Beauties
content:
Welcome back for the second installment of the MADE Australia photo extravaganza. This time I’ll be sharing some of the gravel bikes that were in attendance, but I’ll mix a few cargo bikes in there as well. Oh, and make sure you check out the awesome paint job that was on display by Squid Bikes.

Let’s get started.

Gravel Bikes

Curve Cycling

Back in 2012, when Founder Steve Vagara started Curve Cycling, he saw an opportunity to offer fellow riders high-spec products without the excessive marketing noise. Adventure is at the core of Curve Cycling’s identity, whether it’s taking the long way home or racing across the country, adventure is built into Curve’s DNA.

Curve GMX+

Devlin Cycles

Using the modern look, but taking cues from cycling’s past, Devlin Cycles’ Founder and fabricator, Sean Doyle designs his bikes to be functional first. Along with that functionality Doyle’s creations still have that classy, modern aesthetic about them that gives a ride that is smooth but responsive, that dances when pushed hard.

Devlin Momentum Neon

Lost Workshop

“Ian built his first handmade bicycle frame – a lugged steel gem from Columbus tubing, back in 2016. In 2018, The Lost Workshop is a culmination of Ian’s lifelong passion for designing, building, and riding bikes. His work is “no fuss” and adorned with classic and clean lines, with a touch of modern.“

Lost Workshop Green

Simpatico Bikes

Simpatico Bikes pulls its brand name from the Italian word meaning “easy to live with”. This reflects the ethos of Co-Founders Jeff Servaas and Bandon Stewart in their desire to create aesthetically pleasing and durable titanium bikes that are, indeed “easy to live with”.

Simpatico Bunyip

Simpatico Gamma

Woods Bicycle Co.

“This family business is driven by bike-obsessed brothers who combine skill, attention to detail, and innovation to redefine your cycling experience. With a strong racing and fabrication background, they infuse each frame with expertise and passion, ensuring top-notch quality while meeting all of your biking needs“.

Woods Nomad

Wilde Bicycle Co.

Jeffrey Frane the Founder of Wilde Bikes “pours his heart, soul, knowledge, experience, and passion into creating the finest bicycles. Once the Founder and fearless leader of the legendary All-City Cycles, Jeffery now leads the team at Wilde. Inspiring the team to utilize their network of talented friends, fabricators, artists, and partner shops. All of this is to create a unique footprint in the industry.

Wilde Dream Engine

Squid Bikes

“Riding bikes is about as dumb and futile an endeavor as many other hobbies, which is to say it’s worthwhile and existentially gratifying in ways that are hard to explain. Bikes are simple machines that bring deep joy. They’re a way to find clarity and peace, not to mention a great way to get around”.

Squid Bikes NFT (Gravel Track?)

Cargo Bikes

Dutch Cargo Bike

Dutch Cargo is a pioneering company specializing in the import, distribution, and retail of high-end premium and luxurious European eBikes and eCargo Bikes, like Tern, Urban Arrow, Riese and Muller, and the cool Larry vs Harry Bullitt custom-built cargo bike below.

Larry vs Harry Bullitt Cargo Bike (custom build)

Omnium Cargo

Working as a bike messenger since 2002, Omnium Founder, Jimmi “Jumbo” Bargisen knew a thing or two about what he wanted out of a bike, how it should ride, and what it should be capable of. in 2012, he designed his dream bike…and Omnium came to be.

Omnium Cargo V3

MADE.Bike

author: Ron Frazelle
